title: Where is the baseline in basketball? - Quora

response.answer_text: The baseline is the end line at each “end” of the court. The court boundaries demarcating the long dimension of the court. So, when “a player drives baseline” this is referring to a dribble drive from the wing toward that boundary. Of course if their foot touches that line, they went out of bounds. Or, another example is that after a team scores, the opposing team will be in-bounding from the baseline.
